content.html:
Just style, but I'm not very fan of large indentations. I usually propose:

if (! this->bulletScrew)
{
    gzerr << "bulletScrew not created yet.\n";
    return;
}

if (_index == 0)
...

it helps readability and the detection of bugs.

pull_request.title: implement screw joint in simbody and clean up screw joint constraint in ode

pullrequest.title: implement screw joint in simbody and clean up screw joint constraint in ode

content.raw:
I've been doing some testing with the pr2. It has screw joints for lifting the torso and for the grippers. Note that due to
[gazebo_models issue 14](#!/osrf/gazebo_models/issue/14/pr2-effort-limits-are-all-zero),
the model.sdf must be modified to increase the joint effort limits so that the joint control widget can be used.

After modifying the model.sdf, I set up a test case in which I visualize joints, with transparency. On the default branch, if I apply an effort of `1.0` at the `torso_lift_motor_screw_joint` (which is actually a revolute joint that is connected to the screw joint) then I can see one of the joint markers start spinning and the torso slowly start to lift up. If I set the effort back to zero, it slowly descends.

On this branch, a negative effort is required to make the torso lift.

I would like to make a test based on the pr2 from the current default branch level of functionality to ensure that we don't change the behavior of the ODE screw joint with this pull request.
content.html:
I've been doing some testing with the pr2. It has screw joints for lifting the torso and for the grippers. Note that due to gazebo_models issue 14, the model.sdf must be modified to increase the joint effort limits so that the joint control widget can be used.

After modifying the model.sdf, I set up a test case in which I visualize joints, with transparency. On the default branch, if I apply an effort of 1.0 at the torso_lift_motor_screw_joint (which is actually a revolute joint that is connected to the screw joint) then I can see one of the joint markers start spinning and the torso slowly start to lift up. If I set the effort back to zero, it slowly descends.

On this branch, a negative effort is required to make the torso lift.

I would like to make a test based on the pr2 from the current default branch level of functionality to ensure that we don't change the behavior of the ODE screw joint with this pull request.
